bio: A photographic cooperative of great diversity and distinction owned by its photographer members.

list.comment:
To mark Thanksgiving today, we are looking back at images of the famous Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade taken by Magnum photographers over the last 50 years.
.
PHOTO: Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. NYC, USA. 1988
.
© #ElliottErwitt/#MagnumPhotos
.
#Erwitt #Snoopy #thanksgiving #Macys #MacysThanksgivingDayParade

"Once the inhabitants of expansive strips of untouched greenery, virgin beaches, and ports right on the Caribbean Sea, the Garifuna have lost thousands of acres to greed, corruption, foreign business interests, and tourism"- Sarah Kinosian
.
@susanmeiselas travels to Honduras, where the Garifuna are fighting to preseve their land. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Local beach where fisherman launch daily. Rio Esteban. Honduras. 2018
.
© @susanmeiselas/#MagnumPhotos with support from the @PulitzerCenter

"With their culture at stake, they are leading a movement to reclaim their ancestral lands through occupation. They are building homes and planting crops on territory they say is rightfully theirs." - Sarah Kinosian
.
@susanmeiselas visits Honduras, where the Garifuna people are fighting for a place to raise their families. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Paulina, 57, harvesting and replanting yucca. Guadalupe. Honduras. 2018
.
© @susanmeiselas/#MagnumPhotos with support from the @PulitzerCenter

Following the exhibition in Madrid, 'Players: Magnum Photographers Come out to Play', is travelling to Logroño, where it opens on December 5.
.
The exhibition, which is curated by @lademiddel and @martinparrstudio, explores the myriad connotations of the word 'play'. From music to sport, the show brings together the work of 51 Magnum photographers and features more than 180 images from the archive.
.
For more info, please visit magnumphotos.com/events.
.
PHOTO: Children playing in a playground. Havana, Cuba. 2000
.
© #AlexWebb (@webb_norriswebb)/#MagnumPhotos
.
#exhibition #Players #Havana #Cuba #streetphotography

"Harry Gruyaert ignores the grammar of center and edge; finds the blurred boundaries of overlapping life, the places where one thing has begun to be another thing." - Richard Nonas
.
Harry Gruyaert's 'Rivages' explores the edges where land meets oceans, seas and rivers. As a new edition of the book is published, we share a selection of Gryuaert's images from the series alongside a poetic essay by American sculptor Richard Nonas. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Fort Mahon beach, Baie de Somme. France. 1991
.
© #HarryGruyaert/#MagnumPhotos
.
#Rivages #photobook @thamesandhudson @editions_textuel

Following the exhibition at @rencontresarles early this year, 'Rene Burri: The Imaginary Pyramids' has opened this week at Jimei x Arles International Photo Festival in Xiamen, China, where it will be showing until January 2, 2019.
.
The exhibition, curated by Clotilde Burri-Blanc and Sam Stourdzé, focuses on the late Magnum photographer’s extensive use of pyramid motifs in his photographic works.
.
Burri's early fascination with pyramids began during a childhood spent growing up amongst the alpine mountains of Switzerland. A later discovery of the pyramid of Saqqara on his first trip to Egypt in 1958 strengthened this interest, and over the course of his career, he traveled extensively to Mexico, Guatemala, and Egypt to document these wonders. .
For more info, please visit magnumphotos.com/events.
.
PHOTO: Monument to the Unknown Soldier. Funeral of President Anwar El Sadat. Cairo. Egypt. 1981
.
© @fondationreneburri/#MagnumPhotos
.
#ReneBurri #pyramid #exhibition

"He photographs the vibrating boundaries between what he finds and what he has, between what he knows and what he feels; the shaky boundaries between what he discovers and what he makes himself; the blurred boundaries, I mean, between what sustains him and what moves him."
.
American sculptor Richard Nonas offers a poetic response to the work of Harry Gruyaert in the introductory essay to 'Rivages'. See more on Magnum today. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Biarritz, France. 2000
.
© #HarryGruyaert/#MagnumPhotos
.
#Rivages #photobook @thamesandhudson @editions_textuel

“When we said that in a family there was no bread it was not a metaphor” - Ferdinando Scianna
.
Growing up arround poverty in Sicily, Magnum photographer Ferdinando Scianna's childhood impacted his approach to his work documenting poverty in Naples in the mid-90s. The photographer's own experience informed his concern to protect the “integrity and dignity” of his subjects, who, despite the precariousness of daily life, are shown in his portraits as composed, affectionate and house-proud.
.
In a new interview, we speak to Scianna about the work, and how the issues highlighted persist in the region today. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Part of a large family living from hand to mouth in the old center of Aversa. Naples. Italy. 1995
.
© #FerdinandoScianna/#MagnumPhotos

“Works of art do not cross paths in the street every day, they don’t sit at the table opposite you” – Madame Helena Rubinstein
.
We take a look inside the beauty school of one of the USA’s first self-made millionaire businesswomen today on Magnum. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Helena Rubinstein Beauty School. New York City, USA. 1958
.
© @ingemorath/#MagnumPhotos
.
#IngeMorath #HelenaRubinstein #beautysalon #beautyschool

"I don’t think there’s a “better” or a “good” portrait subject. A meaningful portrait arises out of so many of layers of personal history, interest, circumstances and relationships, that it’s pointless to try to define it. Everybody’s interesting. It all depends who’s looking, how, and why." - @alessandra_sanguinetti
.
As she prepares to judge the inaugural @portrait_of_humanity Award, by @bjp1854 and Magnum Photos, @alessandra_sanguinetti discusses portraiture as an integral part of her practice. Link in bio.
.
The inaugural @portrait_of_humanity Award is open now. You can find out more info about how to apply on magnumphotos.com. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Belinda. Buenos Aires, Argentina. 2007
.
© @alessandra_sanguinetti/#MagnumPhotos
.
#AlessandraSanguinetti #PortraitofHumanity #portraiture

The representation of poverty is at once political and personal, revealing as much about society as it does about the person who documents it. But what is universal, is that the representation of poverty is never just about poverty. It’s about powerlessness, prejudice, stigma, suppression and a myriad of other complex structures of suffering.
.
Today on Magnum: In the first part of a new series, Sohrab Hura talks frankly about the complexity of documenting poverty and how confronting these issues led his photographic practice to evolve. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Women break rocks in an MGNREGA worksite. Madhya Pradesh, India. 2006
.
© @sohrabhura/#MagnumPhotos

Today on Magnum: We explore the story of émigré entrepreneurship and all-American commerce behind Inge Morath's photographs of groundbreaking beauty businesswoman Helena Rubinstein's New York studio. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Beauty class at the Helena Rubinstein Salon. New York City, USA. 1958
.
© @ingemorath/#MagnumPhotos
.
#IngeMorath #HelenaRubinstein #beautysalon #beautyschool

Today on Magnum: We speak to @portrait_of_humanity Award judge @alessandra_sanguinetti about some of her best-known projects – including The Adventures of Guille and Belinda - as well as what interests her about photographing youth, and why it's important to stay true to yourself. Link in bio.
.
The inaugural @portrait_of_humanity Award with @bjp1854 is open now.
.
PHOTO: The Madonna. Buenos Aires, Argentina. 2001
.
© @alessandra_sanguinetti/#MagnumPhotos
.
#AlessandraSanguinetti #PortraitofHumanity #portraiture

Magnum photographer Ferdinando Scianna spent a year documenting poverty in Naples in the mid-90s. Today, the number of those living below the line is the highest in more than a decade.

In a new interview, we speak to Scianna about his work in Southern Italy and how the issues highlighted then persist today. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Retired woman living in one room flat open to the street called "vasci". Naples, Italy. 1994
.
© #FerdinandoScianna/#MagnumPhotos

Now on the Magnum Shop: we have signed copies of the new publication of Alec Soth's classic photobook, 'Niagara'. The book is available now on shop.magnumphotos.com.
.
You can see more work from the project in our recent feature on Magnum. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Niagara Falls. USA/Canada. 2005
.
© #AlecSoth(@littlebrownmushroom)/#MagnumPhotos
.
#Niagara #NiagaraFalls #photobook

From the archive: Los Angeles. USA. 2001
.
© #ConstantineManos/#MagnumPhotos
.
#streetphotography #colorphotography #LosAngeles

To mark Thanksgiving today, we are looking back at images of the famous Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade taken by Magnum photographers over the last 50 years.
.
PHOTO: Balcony overlooking the Thanksgiving Day Parade on Central Park West. New York City, USA. 1992
.
© @burtglinnphoto/#MagnumPhotos
.
#BurtGlinn #thanksgiving #Macys #MacysThanksgivingDayParade

“For me, it is just as important to help a human being become beautiful as it is to sculpt a great statue or paint a fine portrait” – Madame Helena Rubinstein
.
Today on Magnum, we take a look inside acerbic cosmetics mogul Madame Helena Rubinstein's beauty school empire. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Helena Rubinstein at home with her art collection. Paris, France. 1957
.
© @ingemorath/#MagnumPhotos
.
#IngeMorath #HelenaRubinstein #beautysalon #beautyschool

From chairman of the SNCC to Honorary Prime Minister of the Black Panther Party, we look back at the political trajectory of key Black Power figurehead Stokely Carmichael, who died 20 years ago today. Link in bio.
.
Danny Lyon was staff photographer for the SNCC (Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee), the grass-roots activist group responsible for the ‘sit-ins’ and Freedom Rides in segregated restaurants and public transport in the Southern United States. Initially a volunteer, Stokely Carmichael was the group’s chairman in 1966-1967.
.
PHOTO: Stokely Carmichael and the Maryland National Guard. Spring 1964. Cambridge, Maryland. USA
.
© @dannylyonphotos/#MagnumPhotos
.
#DannyLyon #StokelyCarmichael #civilrightsmovement #SNCC

French philosopher and writer Jean-Paul Sartre. Pont des Arts. Paris, France. 1946. #WorldPhilosophyDay
.
© @fondationhcb/#MagnumPhotos
.
#HenriCartierBresson #CartierBresson #Sartre #JeanPaulSartre #philosophy

Herbert List 'The Magical in Passing' presents a curation of 120 images that sheds light on the multifaceted work of the German photographer. From architecture to still life, portraiture to street photography, the show explores the blurred boundaries that makes the Magnum photographer's work so difficult to categorize.
.
The exhibition is currently showing at the Ludwig Galerie Saarlouis in Germany. You can find more information about this and more Magnum exhibitions at magnumphotos.com/events.
.
PHOTO: "Water Games I". North Sea. Germany. 1934
.
© #HerbertList/#MagnumPhotos
.
#exhibition

From the archive: Hotel in Akasaka area. Tokyo, Japan. 1996
.
© @pinkhassov/#MagnumPhotos
.
#Pinkhassov #Tokyo #streetphotography

Magnum photographer @jeromesessini recently travelled to Mexico for @TIME, following the migrant caravan as it made its way to Mexico City. Sessini's photos offer an intimate look at life for the Central American migrants travelling with the caravan, as they make their way to the US. You can see more images on @TIME's Instagram, and you can find the link to the full story in this week's Magnum Digest. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Central American migrants, who are part of the caravan that left San Pedro Sula, Honduras on Oct. 12, bathe and brush their teeth inside the Jesus Martinez stadium, in Mexico City. Mexico. November 5, 2018.
.
© @jeromesessini/#MagnumPhotos
.
#JeromeSessini #TIME #migrantcaravan #migration

Today on Magnum: More than two centuries after settling in Honduras, the Garifuna people are still fighting for a place to raise their families. Link in bio.
.
Originally published in @pacificstand's 'A Journey Through Contested Lands' photo issue, this work was made possible with support from @PulitzerCenter.
.
PHOTO: El Mirador, with the UK Marella cruise ship in bay and statue of Christopher Columbus pointing to where he first landed in Central America. Trujillo. Honduras. 2018
.
© @susanmeiselas/#MagnumPhotos with support from the @PulitzerCenter

"Stay focused on your point of view and don’t try to please. The more personal your gaze, the more layered and interesting the portrait will be." - @alessandra_sanguinetti
.
In a new interview on Magnum, @alessandra_sanguinetti discusses portraiture and photographing youth, plus she shares some advice for aspiring portrait photographers. Link in bio.
.
The inaugural @portrait_of_humanity Award is open now. You can find out more info about how to apply on magnumphotos.com. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Brooklyn, NY. USA. 1992
.
© @alessandra_sanguinetti/#MagnumPhotos
.
#AlessandraSanguinetti #PortraitofHumanity #portraiture

"How could I continue to parachute into someone else’s life and photograph another mother when I couldn’t photograph my own?" - Sohrab Hura
.
Sohrab Hura has been photographing marginalized communities in his home country of India for more than ten years. But along the way, he has grappled with questions of representation, accountability and the vulnerability of photographic subjects. Today on magnumphotos.com, Hura explains how in order to face these uncomfortable truths, he had to turn the lens on himself—and in doing so his practice metamorphosed. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Ma smokes incessantly. On her bad days sometimes she doesn't believe that I'm her son. India. 2006
.
© @sohrabhura/#MagnumPhotos

Today on Magnum: On the 20th anniversary of his death, we look back at the political trajectory of divisive Black Power figurehead Stokely Carmichael, from student protestor, to one of the most prominent voices of the Civil Rights Movement. Link in bio.
.
Hiroji Kubota photographed Carmichael’s speech at the NYC Peace March in protest of the Vietnam War in 1967, where he shared the stage with Martin Luther King.
.
PHOTO: USA. 1967
.
© #HirojiKubota/#MagnumPhotos
.
#stokelycarmichael #SNCC #civilrightsmovement

The @fondationhcb has inaugurated its new space in Le Marais, Paris with a celebratory Martine Franck retrospective, which is showing now.
.
Curated by the Foundation's co-founder and artist director, Agnès Sire, the large-scale exhibition pays homage to Franck's work, journeying through her most seminal photographic series: from activist gatherings to meditative landscapes, political engagement to friendly portraits.
.
For more information, please visit magnumphotos.com/events.
.
PHOTO: Pool designed by Alain Capeilleres. Town of Le Brusc. Provence, France. 1976
.
© #MartineFranck/#MagnumPhotos
.
#exhibition #retrospective #streetphotography

You can join Magnum's @markosian at the New School University Center in New York on December 4, where she will be discussing her new series 'Santa Barbara', which reconstructs her family's journey from Russia to America, inspired by the 1980s soap opera of the same name.
.
The panel discussion coincides with the forthcoming 'Family' issue of @aperturefnd magazine, which features a portfolio of work from @markosian's new series, and will consider how artists and photographers have chronicled their relationships to their families and communities. @markosian will be speaking alongside Justine Kurland and Zun Lee, in a conversation moderated by Lois Braverman.
.
The talk is free to attend. You can find more info via @aperturefnd.
.
PHOTO: My family arrived to America in 1996. My mother described it as the arrival to nowhere, with the hope of going somewhere. USA. 2018
.
© @markosian/#MagnumPhotos

To mark Thanksgiving today, we are looking back at images of the famous Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade taken by Magnum photographers over the last 50 years.
.
PHOTO: Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. New York City, USA. 1986
.
© @philipjonesgriffiths/#MagnumPhotos
.
#thanksgiving #Macys #MacysThanksgivingDayParade

"Photographing others remains something that I still struggle with, especially when I am aware of the many hierarchies that might exist between us. I am sure I have made many mistakes along the way but if I choose to photograph others I have no choice at a time when context is always in flux." - Sohrab Hura
.
Today on Magnum, Hura talks frankly about the complexity of photographing the marginalized and how his practice has evolved as he has confronted these issues. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Umrao’s brother with his daughter. Barwani. India. 2014
.
© @sohrabhura/#MagnumPhotos

The representation of poverty is at once political and personal, revealing as much about society as it does about the person who documents it. But what is universal, is that the stories are never just about poverty; they are about powerlessness, prejudice, stigma, suppression and a myriad of other complex structures of suffering.
.
Today on Magnum, we speak to Ferdinando Scianna about his own experience of poverty, how his childhood informed his work documenting the lives of those living on the bread line in Naples in the 90s, and how the issues highlighted at the time remain today. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: One of five children living in a one room flat with his family. Naples, Italy. 1994
.
© #FerdinandoScianna/#MagnumPhotos

A major retrospective of Magnum co-founder Robert Capa's work is currently showing at the Arengario in Monza, Italy.
.
This exhibition includes over 100 black and white photos taken by Capa between 1936 and 1954, from his work documenting major conflicts to his portraits of artists such as Matisse and Picasso.
.
The exhibition is on show until January 24, 2019. For more info, please visit magnumphotos.com/events.
.
PHOTO: Motorcyclists and woman walking on the road from Nam Dinh to Thai Binh. Indochina, Vietnam. May, 1954
.
© #RobertCapa © @icp/#MagnumPhotos
.
#Capa #retrospective #exhibition #Monza

From the archive: Florida Keys. USA. 1968
.
© #ElliottErwitt/#MagnumPhotos
.
#streetphotography #FloridaKeys #blackandwhitephotography

A new exhibition showing at @bronxdocumentarycenter now pays tribute to the work of Magnum photographer Tim Hetherington and Chris Hondros, who risked their lives to raise awareness of the Liberian Civil Wars.
.
The photos in this exhibition, some never before shown, are a tribute to these journalists, and to the Liberian civilians who protested so powerfully and demanded an end to the violence. In 2011, Tim and Chris, friends and colleagues committed to documenting the truth, were killed by artillery in Misurata, Libya.
.
'War and Peace in Liberia' is showing at the Bronx Documentary Center until December 16, 2018.
.
PHOTO: Young rebel fighter and hand grenade. Tubmanburg, Liberia. June 16th, 2003
.
© #TimHetherington/#MagnumPhotos
.
#Liberia #exhibition #bronxdocumentarycenter

"I first used [the telephoto] lens when shooting in one of my favourite beach locations: Mar del Plata, a huge, crazy resort in Argentina. This lens, with its ability to flatten and compress, has been somewhat shunned by the art world (with the honourable exception of Beat Strueli) so I was keen to explore what was possible." - @martinparrstudio
.
From black and white to color, wide angle to the telephoto lens, @martinparrstudio traces the technical development of his practice through the beaches he has photographed. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Grandé Beach. Mar Del Plata, Argentina. 2014
.
© @martinparrstudio/#MagnumPhotos
.
#MartinParr #BeachTherapy #photobook #beach

Today on Magnum: American sculptor Richard Nonas poetically explores "the blurred boundaries of overlapping life" in Harry Gruyaert's book, 'Rivages' (‘Edges’). Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Ostend, Belgium. 1988
.
© #HarryGruyaert/#MagnumPhotos
.
#Rivages #photobook @thamesandhudson @editions_textuel

@martinparrstudio has often used the beach as a laboratory to experiment with new cameras and techniques. In his latest book, 'Beach Therapy', he does so with a telephoto lens.
.
Signed copies of the new book are available now on shop.magnumphotos.com.
.
PHOTO: St. Ives. Cornwall. England. 2017
.
© @martinparrstudio/#MagnumPhotos
.
#MartinParr #Beach #BeachTherapy #photobook

For @martinparrstudio, the beach is "a human laboratory where I can experiment with new ideas and approaches, using the location to explore what is possible with the camera."
.
@martinparrstudio explores the seaside as a fertile ground for his work, in his new book, 'Beach Therapy'. Link in bio.
.
Signed copies of the book are available now on shop.magnumphotos.com.
.
PHOTO: St Ives, Cornwall. England, GB. 2018
.
© @martinparrstudio/#MagnumPhotos
.
#MartinParr #BeachTherapy #photobook #beach

Today on Magnum: In an excerpt from his new book, 'Beach Therapy', @martinparrstudio traces the technical development of his practice through the beaches he has photographed. Link in bio.
.
PHOTO: Ventnor, Isle of Wight. England, GB. 2018
.
© @martinparrstudio/#MagnumPhotos
.
#MartinParr #BeachTherapy #photobook #beach
